Articles.Content:
So you find the engines in KSP a little underwhelming and think you could do better? Want to build a clock? I want to see all your weird and wonderful creations!

Heres a few of mine to get you in the mood.

Javascript is disabled. View full album
Javascript is disabled. View full album
Love the train, I'd love to have rails all over Kerbin but the part count makes my RAM's orifices bleed...
Shouldn't this be in the Spacecraft Exchange?
Great work! These look great!

Shouldn't this be in the Spacecraft Exchange?

or here... where people actually read threads?

these look pretty good, wish we had some stock bearings

So you find the engines in KSP a little underwhelming and think you could do better? Want to build a clock? I want to see all your weird and wonderful creations!

I trust you'll actually be building a clock? I just got... er I'm presuming that when I reload KSP after it crashed that I just got the pendulum to work properly on my Grandfather Clock...

or here... where people actually read threads?

these look pretty good, wish we had some stock bearings

Dude, you can make them with very few parts. Depending on what it needs to do, you can get away with as few as five or six parts...

As for stock stuff...

Ferris Wheel (download in sig)

Javascript is disabled. View full album
Javascript is disabled. View full album

A bunch of Turrets (download in sig)

Don't know what to call this, other than it's supposed to be an SSTO that incorporates a turret that works. It works. You can spin around all day long. But it can't handle anything attached to it. Kerbals survive the trip up in the command seat!

And I also have a couple of really ugly and badly performing helicopters. And some trucks with articulated trailers in varying stages of disrepair. And some other weird contraptions in varying states...

I trust you'll actually be building a clock? I just got... er I'm presuming that when I reload KSP after it crashed that I just got the pendulum to work properly on my Grandfather Clock...

Dude, you can make them with very few parts. Depending on what it needs to do, you can get away with as few as five or six parts...

As for stock stuff...

Ferris Wheel (download in sig)

http://imgur.com/a/BKpny

http://imgur.com/a/uZ2B7

A bunch of Turrets (download in sig)

http://i.imgur.com/kWrbofR.jpg

Don't know what to call this, other than it's supposed to be an SSTO that incorporates a turret that works. It works. You can spin around all day long. But it can't handle anything attached to it. Kerbals survive the trip up in the command seat!

http://i.imgur.com/aCOYae8.png

And I also have a couple of really ugly and badly performing helicopters. And some trucks with articulated trailers in varying stages of disrepair. And some other weird contraptions in varying states...

Some sweet looking stuff here! Making a clock is on my list of things to do but Im trying to make a boat using a turboprop engine and the f35b fan using a jet turbine at the mo!

- - - Updated - - -

or here... where people actually read threads?

these look pretty good, wish we had some stock bearings

These things arent to bad though.

And the pendulum works. Kind of...

Jet engines spin the big wheels (so that they're kept in sync). Those are attached to shafts with a single tooth that intersects with the pendulum's bearing in order to "help" it up. Gets stuck too easily though... But it's getting there. Take that Space. Who goes to Space anyway?

And the pendulum works. Kind of...

http://i.imgur.com/p6CiT5T.gif

Jet engines spin the big wheels (so that they're kept in sync). Those are attached to shafts with a single tooth that intersects with the pendulum's bearing in order to "help" it up. Gets stuck too easily though... But it's getting there. Take that Space. Who goes to Space anyway?

how long does the pendulum swing for? This thing has about 3 you swings before loosing all momentum.

Edited September 19, 2015 by erasmusguy
...There's something unwholesome about a recursive turbojet. That will bring nightmares. Well played. XD

http://i.imgur.com/8XV4Z5H.png

how long does the pendulum swing for? This thing has about 3 you swings before loosing all momentum.

You should set an engine to give it a little extra push at the height of one swing or the other - this is similar to how a real pendulum works, where a small amount of energy in the mainspring is released into the pendulum to keep it swinging.

http://i.imgur.com/8XV4Z5H.png

how long does the pendulum swing for? This thing has about 3 you swings before loosing all momentum.

I had the same problem, well mine would only manage one swing on account of it not being that heavy. That pendulum will now however, theoretically, swing until the fuel runs out. Reality, the teeth stick, and it gets all jammed up quite easily.

Shouldn't this be in the Spacecraft Exchange?

I think it is places perfectly.

Yes it is about crafts but moreover it is about what you can do in KSP
This exchange of craft has been moved to the craft exchange subforum.

This exchange of craft has been moved to the craft exchange subforum.

Its more about the technology side than craft files but I can understand why you moved it.

Im currently making a guide of KME (bearing and the likes) and will link to here.

You sir, are a genius.

Keep up the good work!

I need some help with spinny things, I'm trying to make a propellor without engines (don't matter if it dont fly.) and none of my attempts have worked, all of them don't spin or the propellor falls off.
